intro: Kickxia petrana, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots that allow it to survive in dry conditions. Kickxia petrana is often found in rocky soils and is a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
